intro: Dorstenia rhodesiana, commonly known as the Rhodesian mountain vine, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It is a member of the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and fleshy, spirally arranged leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often with a distinctive star-shaped appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and greenhouses.
